reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports on 1 May 2023 and 15 October 2023
summary:
The Security Council:

Reaffirms previous resolutions and statements on Abyei and the Sudan-South Sudan border, stressing full compliance and implementation.

Reaffirms commitment to Sudan and South Sudan's sovereignty, independence, unity, and territorial integrity.

Recognizes the situation in Abyei and along the border continues to threaten international peace and security.

Decides to:

1. Extend UNISFA's mandate until 15 November 2023, under Chapter VII, and tasks as set out in resolutions 1990 (2011), 2630 (2022), and 2609 (2021).

2. Extend UNISFA's support to JBVMM until 15 November 2023, as set out in resolutions 2024 (2011) and 2075 (2012).

3. Maintain authorized troop and police ceilings as set out in resolution 2609 (2021).

4. Urge Sudan and South Sudan to support UNISFA, facilitate its deployment, and demilitarize the Abyei Area.

5. Request the Secretary-General to report on UNISFA's progress in implementing its mandate.

6. Remain actively seized of the matter.
